title: [QUESTION] SkiaSharp with Unity
body:
SkiaSharp works great inside Unity Editor and on Android but fails to build for iOS since it needs Xamarin.iOS.  
  
I got it to build using the .NetStandard1.3 libraries but now it throws DLLNotFound exception on device (I have the .framework linked)  
  
Is there any way to get it to work on iOS without using Xamarin.iOS?

Here's the Exception with .NetStandard1.3 libraries on iOS
```
DllNotFoundException: Unable to load DLL 'libSkiaSharp': The specified module could not be found.
  at SkiaSharp.SkiaApi.sk_surface_new_raster (SkiaSharp.SKImageInfoNative& info, System.IntPtr rowBytes, System.IntPtr props) [0x00000] in <00000000000000000000000000000000>:0 
  at SkiaSharp.SKSurface.Create (SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info, System.Int32 rowBytes, SkiaSharp.SKSurfaceProperties props) [0x00000] in <00000000000000000000000000000000>:0 
  at SkiaSharp.SKSurface.Create (SkiaSharp.SKImageInfo info) [0x00000] in <00000000000000000000000000000000>:0 
  at MemeEditor.UpdatePreview () [0x00000] in <00000000000000000000000000000000>:0 
  at MemeEditor.Start () [0x00000] in <00000000000000000000000000000000>:0 
```

comments.author: FaizanDurrani
comments.body:
Okay, so I managed to make it work. I just copied the whole Bindings' source over to my unity project and built the unity project using `__IOS__` and `__UNIFIED__` definitions. This allowed all the extern calls to go to the .framework instead of the .dll on iOS. I couldn't find any trace of Xamarin.iOS namespace in the actual source so no compiler errors were thrown.

The 'proper' way I guess would be to rebuild the bindings for Unity IOS with proper references but this works for now.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I am going to reopen this as this is a good issue. We do need to solve this. You might be able to use the .config way with the .net standard library.

https://www.mono-project.com/docs/advanced/pinvoke/dllmap/

`SkiaSharp.dll.config`:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<configuration>
  <dllmap dll="libSkiaSharp" target="@rpath/libSkiaSharp.framework/libSkiaSharp" />
</configuration>
```

_(Not sure if this actually works, seems to be a mono feature...)_

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Seems to be related: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/5112

It _may_ just work...

comments.author: ForkeSeal
comments.body:
> Okay, so I managed to make it work. I just copied the whole Bindings' source over to my unity project and built the unity project using `__IOS__` and `__UNIFIED__` definitions. This allowed all the extern calls to go to the .framework instead of the .dll on iOS. I couldn't find any trace of Xamarin.iOS namespace in the actual source so no compiler errors were thrown.
> 
> The 'proper' way I guess would be to rebuild the bindings for Unity IOS with proper references but this works for now.

I am having the same problem. I have linked libSkiaSharp.framework but get this message
`dyld: Library not loaded: @rpath/libSkiaSharp.framework/libSkiaSharp`
Exactly how did you get the extern calls to go to the .framework instead of the .dll on iOS?

comments.author: FaizanDurrani
comments.body:
Assuming you've already imported the .framework inside unity, copy the Bindings folder from repo source to Unity and build using the following compiler definitions `__IOS__` and `__UNIFIED__`

That should make it work

comments.author: ForkeSeal
comments.body: Thanks @FaizanDurrani I got it to work. There were a few errors once I imported the bindings folder but I got to work in the end.

comments.author: PedroRossa
FaizanDurrani
comments.body:
> Hello folks,
> @FaizanDurrani , please, how you put skiasharp to run on Android in Unity?
> I spent a lot of time but just received different type of errors.

I think I just copied the `.so`s into `Assets/` and imported the `.dll` into `Plugins/Android`. I don't remember if I used my own build or the NuGet one. I'll push the skeleton of the project to Github sometime tomorrow so you can take a look at it.

Can you send your project or some like that? Because we tried a lot and don't be able to use on Android (Oculus Quest to be more precisely)

https://github.com/FaizanDurrani/SkiaSharp-Unity-Test
I've made a repo with the setup of SkiaSharp that I used for Unity. It doesn't have any scripts or scenes but you should be able to get a general idea of how its set up.

comments.author: mightypanda
comments.body:
Hello @lahmidi-developer, and thank you @FaizanDurrani  for your repo.

I found another repo  by @zia95 that has some working SkiaSharp code so should ease your testing on all platforms, even if the skiasharp embedding in that case is only for windows standalone, so i would just grab the drawing code from there.

https://github.com/zia95/Unity-with-SkiaSharp-2.8-Demo

Maybe we could get to a working repo with SkiaSharp on Unity working on all platforms, as well as some "update" instructions?

All the best, let me know if this helps.
